title: Chocolate Tres Leches Cake Recipe
description: Chocolate tres leches cake made with chocolate cake soaked in a 3 milk mixture; top with chocolate cream for a tasty twist on the classic Mexican dessert.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Global Cuisines Latin American Mexican Desserts Chocolate Tres Leches Cake 4.9 (61) 47 Reviews 21 Photos This moist chocolate tres leches cake is a rich and delicious twist on the classic Mexican dessert. It tastes like you spent all day in the kitchen but a boxed mix makes it so easy! Submitted by MrsFisher0729 Updated on April 22, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 21 21 21 21 Prep Time: 35 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Additional Time: 45 mins Total Time: 1 hr 55 mins Servings: 18 Yield: 1 tres leches cake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 18 servings 1 (15.25 ounce) package Swiss chocolate cake mix (such as Duncan Hines®) 1 ¼ cups chocolate milk ½ cup canola oil 3 large eggs 1 teaspoon instant espresso powder 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk ¾ cup half-and-half ¾ cup evaporated milk 3 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder 1 cup confectioners' sugar ½ cup unsweetened cocoa powder 3 cups heavy whipping cream Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13-inch pan. Beat cake mix, chocolate milk, canola oil, eggs, and espresso powder together in a large bowl with an electric hand mixer on a low speed until dry ingredients are moistened. Increase speed to medium and continue beating another 2 minutes; pour into prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 35 minutes. Remove cake from the oven and allow it to cool in the pan until it is no longer hot to the touch. While the cake is still warm, poke lots of holes all over the cake with a small skewer or a fork. Whisk sweetened condensed milk, half-and-half, evaporated milk, and 3 tablespoons cocoa powder together in a bowl until cocoa is mostly incorporated into the liquid; slowly pour chocolate milk mixture evenly over cake. Allow cake to cool completely as liquid soaks into it. Sift confectioners' sugar and cocoa powder together in a bowl. Beat heavy whipping cream in a stand mixer on medium speed for about 1 minute. While continuing to mix, add sugar-and-cocoa mixture to cream in 2 batches, allowing the first to incorporate before adding the second. Increase mixer speed to medium-high; beat until soft peaks form and the cream is thickened and spreadable. Spread chocolate whipped cream on cake to serve. Cook’s Note For variety, you can add 1 tablespoon of coffee-flavored liquor (such as Kahlua) to your milk mixture, or add 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon to your cake batter. I Made It Print 102 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Chocolate Tres Leches Cake 01 of 21 Photo by  Aimee B 02 of 21 Photo by  Aimee B. 06/03/2024 I love Tres Leches cake so definitely wanted to try a chocolate version. It may have been user error and I needed to have poked more holes but I found the liquid ratio to be a bit much, leaving the bottom of the pan "soupy". In terms of taste, it was fantastic. I may make it again and reduce the amount of evaporated milk and half & half. 03 of 21 Photo by  Jeannie McIntire 05/05/2023 I added some homemade caramel to drizzle on this because more sugar and butter is always a good idea. I also used a pudding mix in the drenching liquid and thinned it our with some additional coconut milk to add another flavor element. 04 of 21 Photo by  PeppySage6488 03/17/2022 I forgot the chocolate milk and the espresso in the cake but it was still delicious! I also used Cool Whip with the unsweetened cocoa powder on top. The best part was that it wasn’t too sweet. My girls didn’t really like the cake part but they liked the topping. My brother (whose birthday it was) really enjoyed it. 05 of 21 Photo by  mm 02/05/2021 06 of 21 Photo by  Erika Sager 01/21/2021 This was a hit with everyone who tried it. My mom even asked for the recipe after one bite. I had everything on hand except the chocolate box mix and coffee. I substituted the cake mix with a butter cake mix and a box of chocolate pudding mix, combine them dry until it all looks chocolate, then continue like directed. 07 of 21 Photo by  aziannegurl 05/05/2020 08 of 21 Photo by  Ellen Clark 11/21/2018 09 of 21 Photo by  flower32605 07/12/2018 10 of 21 Photo by  JDBC 02/25/2018 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Sopapilla Cupcakes 50 Ratings Cinco de Chili Chocolate Cupcakes with Chili Cream Cheese Frosting 120 Ratings SPAM®-a-licious Cupcakes with Salted Caramel Frosting 2 Ratings Baked Churro Bites 13 Ratings Cookie Dough Cupcakes 1,441 Ratings Chocolate-Cherry Cupcakes with Cream Cheese Buttercream Frosting Brownie Batter + Cupcake = The SECOND BEST Cupcake. instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Increase speed to medium and continue beating another 2 minutes; pour into prepared pan.;Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 35 minutes. Remove cake from the oven and allow it to cool in the pan until it is no longer hot to the touch. While the cake is still warm, poke lots of holes all over the cake with a small skewer or a fork.;Whisk sweetened condensed milk, half-and-half, evaporated milk, and 3 tablespoons cocoa powder together in a bowl until cocoa is mostly incorporated into the liquid; slowly pour chocolate milk mixture evenly over cake. Allow cake to cool completely as liquid soaks into it.;Sift confectioners' sugar and cocoa powder together in a bowl.;Beat heavy whipping cream in a stand mixer on medium speed for about 1 minute. While continuing to mix, add sugar-and-cocoa mixture to cream in 2 batches, allowing the first to incorporate before adding the second. Increase mixer speed to medium-high; beat until soft peaks form and the cream is thickened and spreadable. Spread chocolate whipped cream on cake to serve.
